parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the route entry.

The description must be 1 to 256 characters in length, and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: DestinationCidrBlock
parameters.description: The destination CIDR block of the route entry. Only IPv4 CIDR blocks, IPv6 CIDR blocks, and prefix lists are supported.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform only a dry run, without performing the actual request. Valid values:

*   **true**: performs a dry run. The system checks the request for potential issues, including the AccessKey pair, the permissions of the RAM user, and the required parameters. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.
*   **false** (default): performs a dry run and performs the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: NewNextHopId
parameters.description: The ID of the new next hop instance.

parameters.name: NewNextHopType
parameters.description: The new next hop type of the route.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The ID of the region to which the route belongs.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: RouteEntryId
parameters.description: The ID of the custom route entry.

parameters.name: RouteEntryName
parameters.description:
The name of the route entry.

The name must be 1 to 128 characters in length, and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: RouteTableId
parameters.description: The ID of the route table to which the route entry belongs.
